content.content: We barely surpassed 65 thousand DAI in circulation thanks to GUSD, maybe because of the problems caused by UST to decentralized currencies (although we know that there was nothing decentralized in that network).  image1920×897 78.7 KB  I think a PSM with these current values only generates loss to Maker or basically a 0-sum game.

I saw that a while ago but given stables in PSMs require no oracle costs and by definition are fixed at a $1 price in code it is probably better to have the PSM than to get rid of it. Will continue to point out these should have multiple price/fee DC tiers (ala GUSD/PSM should have a PSM1, PSM2 and PSM3 with increasing tin/tout price spreads and increasing DCs with the widening spreads) to more act like a real market.
GUSD itself suffers from lack of liquidity and PSM demand is not as high as before as yield farming using Dai is not so high. However, as the market changes, we might see more use for it

More than likely Gemini has many other fish to fry including this one: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-06-02/winklevoss-twins-gemini-is-sued-by-cftc-over-bitcoin-futures Hopefully they’ll show the CFTC who’s boss
